item.title: Openings
item.description: The lab is expanding! We are seeking undergraduate researchers, graduate students, and postdocs/research associates. Undergraduate Researchers Undergraduates interested in gaining research experience examining questions related to host-microbe interactions should reach out to Emily to see whether there are opennings in the lab. Projects in the lab involve bench lab work (wet), computational research (dry), or a combination of both. Prospective researchers should be willing to make a time commitment of at least 8 hours per week to their research during fall and spring semesters.

item.title: Macrobes
item.description: We are! The Macrobe + microbe interaction lab in the Department of Biology at the Pennsylvania State University. We use a combination of wet lab and computational approaches to understand what determines microbiome composition within a host, and how the relationship between the host and the microbiome affects host health and evolution. Emily Davenport Assistant Professor Department of Biology Huck Institutes of the Life Sciences and Institute for Computational and Data Sciences
